title: Solute carrier inhibitors in kidney disease therapy: mechanisms and clinical implications.
abstract: Recent single-cell sequencing analyses confirm that solute carriers (SLCs) are highly expressed in renal tubular epithelial cells, where they are critical for maintaining systemic metabolic homeostasis through solute reabsorption, secretion, and detoxification. SLC dysfunction underpins renal disorders, including chronic kidney disease, diabetic kidney disease, and acute kidney injury. Recent advances in SLC biology have enabled the development of selective inhibitors, offering precise pathway modulation with minimal off-target effects.
